text: Hey everyone, i have an e-commerce build with reactjs and nextjs and i want to migrate only the content part to HubSpot CMS. What I want to achieve is an hybrid approach: my website will be still on my servers and the search page, product page and checkout page will stay as is but i need to edit the other pages like: about us, fa page, ecc. through HubSpot CMS Editor. Is this approach realistic? How can be done?
yes <@UUVQKV146>, this is realistic, you can make it even better by following the concept of headless commerce.
<@UCH1L597V> can you send me some reference? or it is a technical guide where i can read about this approach?
you can take help of this <https://www.bigcommerce.com/articles/headless-commerce/|https://www.bigcommerce.com/articles/headless-commerce/>
<@UCH1L597V> i got it however i cannot understand if i have to retrive static content through HubSpot api. I cannot rewrite the website to make it work in HubSpot Design Manager
all content you can make from page editor and transfer on HubSpot, for products you can fetch them with api, and for checkout you can redirect to your stores checkout page
<@UCH1L597V> ok but in order to achieve this i have to rewrite my website. What i'm looking for is keep my current website architecture and embed pages from HubSpot CMS in a fancy way
